description: TypeScript client SDK for BulutTahsilat Bank Payment Web Service with comprehensive SOAP operations support
rules: Use TypeScript with strict type checking for all BulutTahsilat SDK implementations
Always handle authentication automatically - configure credentials once and reuse the client
Use the BankPaymentServiceClient class as the main entry point for all operations
Implement proper error handling with try-catch blocks and check SOAP fault responses
Never log sensitive payment data like merchant credentials or customer information
Always validate required parameters before making SOAP requests
Use the proper date format helpers from utils/date-formatter.ts for Turkish date formats
Follow the SOAP-based architecture pattern with BaseSoapClient and SoapBuilder
Use XML parser utilities for parsing SOAP responses consistently
Set appropriate timeout values for SOAP operations (default handling in BaseSoapClient)
Use the type definitions from src/types/ for proper request/response typing
Implement unit tests for all new features using Jest
Use the PaymentStatusType enum for consistent payment status handling
Follow the existing code structure: client -> soap layer -> SOAP service
Always use the official BulutTahsilat API documentation as reference for SOAP operations
